page.title: 05The Corn Mill, Heatley.
page.content: There has been a mill on this site since Saxon times,and it is mentioned in records as early as the 14th century .The corn mill has been in the Thornley family since 1896.Roger Thornley has been working at the mill all his life. The oldest piece of machinery is the Swiss water turbine, which was built in Zurich in 1905. It powers the machinery which crushes 5 tonnes of corn a day on average. There are 10 people employed at the mill. They supply animal foodstuffs to farmers in Cheshire. The corn comes from surrounding farms in a 10 mile radius. They also have oats, barley, wheat, fertilizer and pet food. He sells corn in 25 kg. bags or in bulk. The mill is powered mainly by water from the{River Bollin .}
